content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to John Hogan, 14 July 18481 Soon after I received your I went personally to theGenlLand Office, for the information you desired–2Judge Youngtook a memorandum, and promised to do what he could– Last night he sent me what
               accompanies this, which I suppose is all the information can be had–3 Taylorism seems to be going right, for which, I am very glad– Keep the ball rolling–4
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to John Hogan, 14 July 18481

Soon after I received your I went personally to theGenlLand Office, for the information you desired–2Judge Youngtook a memorandum, and promised to do what he could– Last night he sent me what
               accompanies this, which I suppose is all the information can be had–3
Taylorism seems to be going right, for which, I am very glad– Keep the ball rolling–4

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this letter.
2John Hogan’s letter to Lincoln has not been located.

3The accompanying document Lincoln references was not included with this letter and
                  has not been located.
4Reference toZachary Taylorand his bid to win thepresidential election of 1848.
